location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.325 of 1852 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: In relation to the reparations to be made to the British agent at Sharjah, Hajee Yacoob, Kemball encloses a copy of a letter (ff 156-58), sent by Lieutenant Adams, commanding officer of the Company's ship Queen, to Commodore George Robinson, Commanding Indian Navy Squadron in the Persian Gulf, dated 1 September 1852. The report describes the recent tour of the Queenalong the Arab coast, including the despatch and receipt of letters from the British agents at Sharjah and Lingah [Bandar-e Lengeh]. Adams writes of his meeting with Sheikh Abdoola [Abdullah] of Sharjah, to resolve the business of the ill-treatment by his people of the British agent Hajee Yacoob.
